intro: Stillingia cubana, commonly known as Cuban stellaria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Stillingia cubana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and stream banks.
